title: recovering deleted message from mbox file
content:
Hi,

I deleted some messages from my imap mail (using the web interface, not TB) and want to recover them from the locally stored mbox files. On several places, I read that messages are not deleted but merely marked deleted via an X-Mozilla-Status: 0009 flag. I checked the mbox-file and the deleted messages are there, but the X-Mozilla-Status is 0001. But they don't show up in TB. Has there been a recent change to this?

title: Thunderbird freezing after about 20 minutes
content:
After installing Thunderbird on a new windows 11 computer and transferring in the profiles and accounts from the previous computer I the application freezes after about 20 minutes. I have tried all the suggested courses of action. There are no extensions added and the antivirus has an exception for Thunderbird.

The only way to close the error is using task manager to end the program. It does however always say (2) next to Thunderbird in task manager so I am guessing it is trying to do a scheduled action at the point of crashing.

Do you have any suggestions as to what I can try to fix this issue.

Thanks
creator: dianne16

title: Global Inbox. No Advanced button under "Message storage".
content:
Hi, In a new Windows 11 PC Thunderbird 115.81.1 (64-bit) was installed. Then I did /Server Settings/Message storage/Local Directory/F:Mail

The F:\Mail is an external USB-drive. The left pane then showed two main folders:

x@y.no Local Folders

In both of these there is an Inbox sub-folder. The one under "Local Folders" shall be set as the "Global Inbox". In many pages on the web, e.g. a MozillaZine page, it is explained how to do this. The key point here is to navigate to the "Server Settings" and clock on the "Advanced button".

My problem is that there is none; see the uploaded image.

Could anyone, please, tell me where I did my error?

Best regards; ChG
creator: Gustaf17A

title: SMTP issue with Thunderbird 115.8.1
content: Salve, da diverse settimane ho problemi nell'invio di email dal client Thunderbird, quando sono connesso tramite una linea fissa. Ho sottoposto il problema ad un amico esperto. Premesso che l'account di posta e' gestito dal provider REGISTER, che con il client gestisco anche account di altri provider (libero, gmail etc.) che funzionano regolarmente, il test che vi sottopongo e che mi sembra il piu' significativo per comprendere dove sia il problema e' questo: utilizzando telnet e pingando l'smtp, si riscontra un rifiuto da parte del server del provider. La cosa anomala e' che utilizzando dallo stesso MAC outlook le email partono (oath2) mentre da thunderbird no. Potete aiutarmi? Grazie elio

content:

Under X11, clicking a link in an email switches to the web browser and opens the link. If I change the session to Wayland, the link is passed to the browser, but the browser is not brought to the front.

I checked everything is this document: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/hyperlinks-in-messages-not-working but the problem persists.

Thoughts?

title: How to turn off all browser behaviour in TB?
content:
Just moved to TB after 20 years on Mac Mail. Loving it so far, for the most part.

One thing I REALLY do not like is the 'browser behaviour' of Thunderbird. I do not want a second browser on my machine to worry about securing and preventing privacy leaks etc. I have a browser, it's carefully set up, and it's the only i want on my system.

So is there a way to stop TB behaving like a browser? I see questions about 3rd party cookies, they were turned on, and I'm glad I spotted that (could easily have missed it). Can I just turn off all firefox like behaviour? what about "Chat"? I have no use for that.

Thanks

PS - If anyone knows of a way to export my Mac Calendar data to TB, I might try the Calendar function out :)

title: upgrading ubuntu/thunderbird profiles
content:
Hi:

I'm a longtime ubuntu (lubuntu, actually) user, and upgrading LTS versions every 2 years has been pretty easy til now: all I had to do was copy my .thunderbird folder to the home directory of the new system.

When I do that now for the pre-release version of lubuntu 24.04,, the new Thunderbird requires setting up the new profile from scratch, which is a pain, since I use T-bird for multiple accounts.

Is there an easier way of migrating my emails from my old profile to the new system?

Thanks!

Bill

title: ORDINE FILTRI
content:
Ciao ,

ho impostato un filtro ( su casella IMAP ) per fare in modo che : 1) il messaggio venga copiato in una mia cartella ( senza che risulti letto ) 2) nella cartella di posta in arrivo risulti letto

Le azioni che ho impostato sono : 1) Copia il messaggio in 2) Segna come già letto.

Cosi facendo solamente i messaggi non filtrati rimangono nella posta in arrivo evidenziati ( non letti ). Mentre tutti quelli che sono soggetti a filtro vengono copiati in altre cartelle ( non letti cosi ho l'evidenza ) e rimangono nella posta in arrivo come se sono stati letti. Non sposto il messaggio ; essendo il server impostato come IMAP dopo non lo ritroverei più leggendo la posta da altro dispositivo.

TB però mi inverte le azioni ( vedi immagine https://ibb.co/qkcgsZ3 )

Non è possibile fare in modo che le esegua nell'ordine da me specificato ?

Grazie.
creator: luigi.po

title: A New Feature?
content: I am searching for a solution for my problem and maybe this is a possible new feature that would help many users. When I open my thunderbird, all attachements open in a new tab, easy and very usefull because of the invoices i need to pay are always open, and when paid i save+ close them. But then i have to send the invoice attachement to my accountant. So i have to go to the original mail AGAIN forward this mail to the accountant etc.....It would be easy if there was a little button in the open attachement tab that directly opens a new sendmail tab with the open attachement already included in the concept.....Maybe i didn't searched very well....BTW I love thunderbird and install it @ all my customers sites instead of MSOutlook, plugins are fine an email reading is once set up correctly the most easy to read interface. the attachement tab is displaying an url like : imap://my%40mail%2Ecom@imap.mailserver.com:993/fetch%3EUID%3E.INBOX.xxxx%3E128?part=1.2&filename=20210446.pdf&type=application/pdf. I'm on Win11 with latest Thunderbird as default email app and use latest Firefox browser.

Thanks! Eric
